intro: Carajasia, commonly known as the "Brazilian starfruit," is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant produces small, yellow, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. Its leaves are heart-shaped and can be used in traditional medicine. Carajasia thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
